Can someone explain the relationship between TestCase and TestResult? I 
understand that TestResult acts as a collector of test results (which ones 
passed, failed, and had errors). What I don't understand is:

Why does TestCase.run(TestResult) call TestResult.run(TestCase) ?
Why does TestResult.run(TestCase) then call TestCase.runBare() ?

I'm trying to write a TestCase which will repeatedly run a test until the 
test passes or a timeout occurs. I need to understand which run method to 
override.

Thnaks,
Christopher Helck
